thread.title: Miami is getting dumptrucked at home by Clemson
thread.title_full: Miami is getting dumptrucked at home by Clemson

title: Miami is getting dumptrucked at home by Clemson
text:
Miami is getting dumptrucked at home by Clemson Resize Text By Clinton Yates October 24 at 2:29 PM Follow @clintonyates Miami fans right now: Should they check their phone or cover their eyes? pic.twitter.com/ba8LewtOgu 
— Jon Solomon (@JonSolomonCBS) October 24, 2015 
No. 6 Clemson is beating the brakes off of Miami, on the road no less, and it feels like the Hurricanes shouldn’t be allowed back out on the field at Sun Life Stadium after halftime. It was 42-0 at the break , and the Tigers scored three touchdowns in each of the first two quarters. 
The Hurricanes entered Saturday’s game with a 4-2 record but facing continued fan impatience over its extended rebuild under Coach Al Golden , now in his fifth season. But now, down 6 TDs at halftime to a team in your conference in your own barn, Golden might want to update his LinkedIn page. 
Oh yeah, and people are fighting in the stands. #Miami fans scuffling in the stands. Lots of people being ejected. #Clemson up 28-0. pic.twitter.com/vcj0SMuNp3 
— Sefton Ipock (@SeftonIpock) October 24, 2015 OK, Clemson staying on the field at halftime and eating orange slices up 42-0 is the new low for Miami. My goodness. 
— Paul Myerberg (@PaulMyerberg) October 24, 2015 #6 Clemson is absolutely dominating Miami leading 42-0 at half. The Tigers out rushed the Canes 230 to 24. #CLEMvsMIA https://t.co/xj0uGQIWXd 
— ESPN CollegeFootball (@ESPNCFB) October 24, 2015 Clinton Yates is a D.C. native and an online columnist. When he's not covering the city, pop culture or listening to music, he watches sports. A lot of them. sports Success! Check your inbox for details. You might also like: Please enter a valid email address Sign Up
